intro: Erigeron acomanus, commonly known as the New England daisy, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of white ray florets surrounding yellow disk florets. Erigeron acomanus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
